Package data

Class WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory

java.lang.Object
data.WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
data.WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory
public class WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory
extends WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
A WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory is used to construct GeographicPolygons from the data of weather stations.

The internally used Integer key of every position is based on the official weather station id.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Field Details

    • LOCAL_DIRECTORY

      private static java.lang.String LOCAL_DIRECTORY
      The directory where the required data is saved

  • Constructor Details

    • WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory

      public WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory​(java.util.Map<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> features)
      Constructs a new WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory object using the given weighted features.

      These define the feature space and it's scaling. A mapping of a feature f to the value x means: Include data about feature f in the Polygons and scale these data values by a factor of x.

      A generated GeographicPolygon then represents the (quantized) weather course at one position over a later specified time window.

      Parameters:
      features - the WeatherFeatures to use and how to scale them

  • Method Details

    • makeWeatherPolygon

      protected GeographicPolygon makeWeatherPolygon​(double[][] data, double[] meta)
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon from the given polygon data and additional metadata containing the latitude, longitude and elevation.
      Specified by:
      makeWeatherPolygon in class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
      Parameters:
      data - the polygon data
      meta - the metadata, where
      • meta[0] is the latitude
      • meta[1] is the longitude
      • meta[2] is the elevation
      Returns:
      the constructed GeographicPolygon

    • readFeatureData

      protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> readFeatureData​(WeatherFeature feature, java.util.Calendar startTime, int timeSteps, int stepSize) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the course of all GeographicPolygons with regard to a single feature.
      Specified by:
      readFeatureData in class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
      Parameters:
      feature - the feature for which the data should be constructed
      startTime - the start time of the time window
      timeSteps - the number of time steps
      stepSize - the time step size in hours
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the a single dimension of the corresponding polygon data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • readMetaData

      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> readMetaData() throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the metadata of all available positions and maps them to the positions Integer key.

      The metadata contains is structured as follows:

      • meta[0] is the latitude
      • meta[1] is the longitude
      • meta[2] is the elevation
      Specified by:
      readMetaData in class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the corresponding metadata, where
      • meta[0] is the latitude
      • meta[1] is the longitude
      • meta[2] is the elevation
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • fileName

      private java.lang.String fileName​(WeatherFeature feature)
      Maps a WeatherFeature to the corresponding file name in the data directory.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the file name (without file ending)
